perturbation.original_text: Purchase Orders not received by 3:00 p.m. Eastern Time are considered to be received on the following Page 1 business day. Supplier will confirm or reject Purchase Orders within [***] of receipt of the Purchase Order. Orders not rejected in writing within such time will be deemed confirmed and accepted by Supplier.
perturbation.changed_text: Purchase Orders not received by 3:00 p.m. Eastern Time are considered to be received on the following Page 1 business day. Supplier will confirm or reject Purchase Orders within 1 hour of receipt of the Purchase Order. Orders not rejected in writing within such time will be deemed confirmed and accepted by Supplier.
perturbation.explanation: The original text requires Supplier to confirm or reject Purchase Orders within a certain timeframe of receipt of the Purchase Order. The modified text reduces the timeframe to 1 hour. This timeframe is not commercially reasonable and violates general contract law principles, potentially putting undue pressure on the supplier and not allowing sufficient time to properly assess the order, thereby contradicting established business practices.

perturbation.original_text: Within [***] from receipt of the Change Notification, Supplier will either: (1) accept the Specification change at the current price and terms; or (2) submit to PNC a proposal ("Proposal") setting forth the conditions of acceptance that may include a change in price and/or other terms, including documentation to support same. Within [***] the Parties will discuss the Proposal in good faith and exercise their best efforts to agree on the appropriate adjustment if any.
perturbation.changed_text: Within 1 day from receipt of the Change Notification, Supplier will either: (1) accept the Specification change at the current price and terms; or (2) submit to PNC a proposal ("Proposal") setting forth the conditions of acceptance that may include a change in price and/or other terms, including documentation to support same. Within 2 days the Parties will discuss the Proposal in good faith and exercise their best efforts to agree on the appropriate adjustment if any.
perturbation.explanation: The original text requires the parties to discuss the proposal within a given time. The modified text reduces the timeframe to 1 day for accepting the Specification change or submitting a proposal and 2 days for the parties to discuss the proposal. This timeframe is unreasonable and does not allow sufficient time to conduct analysis of the specification change and its effects.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General Contract Law - Reasonableness, Good faith and fair dealing

perturbation.original_text: Either Party may terminate this Agreement for cause if the other Party fails to perform any material provision of this Agreement or commits a material breach of this Agreement which is not corrected within [***] after receiving written notice of the failure or breach. except that if the default is by 6 Supplier that creates an immediate public food safety risk, PNC may terminate this Agreement immediately without regard to any period for correction.
perturbation.changed_text: Either Party may terminate this Agreement for cause if the other Party fails to perform any material provision of this Agreement or commits a material breach of this Agreement which is not corrected within 1 day after receiving written notice of the failure or breach. except that if the default is by 6 Supplier that creates an immediate public food safety risk, PNC may terminate this Agreement immediately without regard to any period for correction.
perturbation.explanation: The original text allows a specified time for a party to correct a material breach. The modified text reduces this timeframe to 1 day which is unreasonable and insufficient to cure breach for some material provisions.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General Contract Law - Reasonableness, Opportunity to Cure
